dt: {bc}similar or comparable to something else either in general or in some specific detail

dt.t: Timbre in music is {wi}analogous{/wi} to color in painting.
An airplane's joystick is somewhat {wi}analogous{/wi} to the reins on a horse.

dt: {bc}similar in a way that invites comparison {bc}showing an {d_link|analogy|analogy} or a likeness that permits one to draw an analogy

dt.t: a town council and a government body that serves an {wi}analogous{/wi} function

pt: {sc}similar{/sc} {sc}analogous{/sc} {sc}parallel{/sc} mean closely resembling each other. {sc}similar{/sc} implies the possibility of being mistaken for each other.

pt.t: all the houses in the development are {it}similar{/it}

pt: {sc}analogous{/sc} applies to things belonging in essentially different categories but nevertheless having many similarities.
{sc}parallel{/sc} suggests a marked likeness in the development of two things.

pt.t: the {it}parallel{/it} careers of two movie stars

quotes.t: … gluons, force particles {qword}analogous{/qword} to the photons of electromagnetism.
… great stretches of algae, {qword}analogous{/qword} to terrestrial woodlands, in which kelp fills the role of trees.
… not by means superior to, though {qword}analogous{/qword} with, human reason …

aq.source: {it}On the Origin of Species by Means of Natural Selection{/it}

et: Latin {it}analogus{/it} "proportionate" (Medieval Latin, "conforming to analogy") + {et_link|-ous|-ous}; {it}analogus{/it} borrowed from Greek {it}análogos{/it} "proportionate, conformable," parasynthetic derivative from {it}anà lógon{/it} "proportionately," from {it}aná{/it} "up, throughout" + {it}lógon,{/it} accusative of {it}lógos{/it} "word, speech, relation, correspondence, proportion" {ma}{mat|ana-|}, {mat|legend|}{/ma}
shortdef: similar or comparable to something else either in general or in some specific detail : similar in a way that invites comparison : showing an analogy or a likeness that permits one to draw an analogy
